reviews.review_msg: She was awesome! good in class, clear, no suprises on the exams, TA's favored people but if you speak out in tutorial you will be fine.

Completely agree with the person that said she's arrogant and offensive. Course material is really easy though. Go to lecture! Don't waste time studying every single feminist in the textbooks, just know MAIN people and MAIN movements. I put in minimal effort and I'm pretty sure I'll get an A+, A after writing the final

Lectures and notes are posted on library reserves. She is arrogant and offensive. I've only come into contact with her via email. In lecture she seemed pleasant, but she is quite in your face with remarks over the email. It'll take a little bit of work to achieve a B+/ A-. Exams are fair. Tutorial participation is 20%. Overall not a hard course.

I took Distance Ed. She is completely useless, I emailed the TA asking a question she told me to email Mary, so I emailed Mary and Mary told me to email the TA... Your essays get marked based on preference of the TA, not based on logic, and also based on if your name is a guys name or not...

Took the distance version, from the comments the lecture would have been much more enjoyable. Distance version required way too much writing for a 100 level course. Study guide provided very little prof guidance.

She is a fantastic prof.  Easy to understand her lecs and the course was an awesome expereince.  She is really funny which acted like an incentive for me to go to her lecs.  Marking wise, she is very fair.
lectures are boring, despite the profs overenthusiasm
Amazing professor. Interesting lectures. Fair exams. I actually looked forward to the homework assignments. A+++

pretty awesome teacher, wish i had gotten to know her better. very funny in class, keeps things interesting. and lectures are organized and comprehensive. I usually dont' go to lectures lol, too far from my house, but i listen to them online which is a big plus for this course. overall,not a hard course and prof and TAs are pretty helpful and clear
Very nice instructor. Talks really fast so you have to keep up. Very helpful with assignments and won't go crazy if you are a bit late with an assignments.

Pretty interesting course. There's a lot of information covered in the lectures. She doesn't give powerpoint notes or anything so you have to take down what she's saying yourself. Surprising not too difficult of a course. Take good notes and you'll do fine.

Lots of reading in course, not hard tho. She talks very fast in lecture, is interesting (given her convictions as a feminist), use film as good teaching aids, teaches historical document analysis as useful tool in deconstructing people & historical periods. Like most Social Scientists, seems a bit techno-phobic. Would take another course by her.
Lectures sometimes boring.  Interesting readings.  Not that difficult of a course.  Suprisingnly not too hard of a marker.
